data.title: News — Filmgate Films
data.text:
In honour of the 80th anniversary of the D-day landings in France, we would like to share a short clip from our co-production "The Great Escaper" that premiered last year.

Directed by Oliver Parker, the film tells the story of Bernard (Michael Caine) who escapes his care home in 2014 to be able to take part of the anniversary celebrations and look back on the past where he fought for his country on the beaches of Normandy together with his comrades.

Watch the clip here: https://youtu.be/7gpSdyZXO5o?feature=shared

We are proud to announce that the feature film "Unicorns", directed by James Krishna Floyd & Sally El Hosaini, co-produced by Filmgate Films, will be having its premier in UK cinemas on July 5th.

The film has been part of numerous festivals around the world after it had its world premier at the Toronto film festival last September. Among those were the BFI in London as well as the Gothenburg Film Festival earlier this year.

You can now also watch the newly released trailer here: https://youtu.be/Vvr8Nh5SdKU?feature=shared

Filmgate Films are happy to announce that our co-production “Sister Midnight”, directed by Karan Kandhari, has been selected for the “Directors’ Fortnight” section at this year’s Festival de Cannes.

The film, produced by Wellington Films and Griffin Pictures, is a dark comedy with a unique new vision that we’re very excited about audiences finally seeing. You can read more about it here:

https://www.screendaily.com/.../protagoni.../5192612.article

Film4, British Film Institute, Protagonist Pictures, Suitable Pictures, Wellington Films, Griffin Pictures, Film i Väst

The History of Sound is an upcoming historical romantic drama directed by Oliver Hermanus. It is based on the short story of the same name by Ben Shattuck about two men who fall in love while traveling together to record the stories and songs of their countrymen during WWI.

The film has wrapped shooting and as co-producers we are excited to continue the work into the post-production phase!

Based on the novel Grief is the Thing With Feathers, The Thing with Feathers follows Benedict Cumberbatch (The Imitation Game, Star Trek Into Darkness) who will play a young father whose hold on reality crumbles following his wife’s death as a strange presence begins to stalk him from the shadowy recesses of the apartment that he shares with his two young sons.

The film has wrapped shooting and as co-producers we are excited to continue the work into the post-production phase!

The powerful drama "Exodus", produced by B-Reel and directed by Abbe Hassan, tells the story of a professional smuggler that tries to save a 12-year-old girl whose family has gone missing in the Syrian war.

Today, the film received 2 nominations for the upcoming Guldbaggen awards: Best Screenplay (Abbe Hassan, Kristoffer Cras) and Best Original Music (Lisa Montan).

Together with the Filmgate VFX-crew that created the visual effects for the film, Filmgate Films wish to extend its biggest congratulations to the team and best of luck at the ceremony!

The feature film "Living", directed by Oliver Hermanus and co-produced by Film i Väst together with Filmgate Films - with Filmgate VFX carrying out all VFX for the film - has recieved three BAFTA nominations and two Oscar nominations!

A special congratulations to Bill Nighy for his two nominations as a leading actor!

Don't forget to watch the BAFTA Film Awards on Sunday February 19th and The 95th annual Academy Awards on March 13th.

The nominations for both BAFTA and the Academy Awards are listed below.

Double Oscar winners Michael Caine and Glenda Jackson have the leading roles in Oliver Parker’s latest project - the warm time drama “The Great Escaper”, which has now started filming. The film is produced by Robert Bernstein and Douglas Rae of Ecosse Films, Pathé and BBC Films. The Swedish co-producers are Film i Väst and Sean Wheelan of Filmgate Films.

In the summer of 2014 Bernard Jordan (Michael Caine) made global headlines. He’d staged a “great escape” from his care home to join fellow war veterans on a beach in Normandy, commemorating their fallen comrades.

It was a story that captured the imagination of the world - Bernie seemed to embody the defiant, “can-do” spirit of a generation that was fast disappearing. But of course, it wasn’t the whole story. It was the story we all tell ourselves to make war and old age bearable. The bitter-sweet script explores the reality with wit and a very big heart.

Filmgate Films and Filmgate VFX are happy to have been involved with director Charlotte Colbert’s feature length debut - “She Will”.

The film centers around an aging film star who retreats to the Scottish countryside with her nurse to recover from surgery. While there, mysterious forces of revenge emerge from the land where witches were burned.

“She Will” premiered at the Locarno Film Festival, where Colbert also won the “Best First Feature” award.

The film is now set to be released in theaters and VOD on July 15th. See the official trailer below!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gh3tVvJdgnk&t=2s

Cristian Mungiu’s new film, “R.M.N.” will have its world premiere at the Cannes Film Festival this Saturday night where it is also competing for the prestigious Palme d’Or.

Filmgate Films co-produced alongside Film i Väst while Filmgate VFX created the VFX for the film.

The official trailer has just been released - please take a look below!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_-7-cOsU1l4

Romanian director and screenwriter Cristian Mungius' drama R.M.N. has been selected for the main competition at the Cannes Film Festival. Produced by Mobra Films Romania and Why Not France, in co-production with Sean Wheelan, Filmgate Films, in co-production with Film i Väst and supported by Eurimages.

A large part of the post production has taken place in Gothenburg with VFX by Filmgate VFX and grading by CAN Film.

A non-judgemental analysis of the driving forces of human behaviour when confronted with the unknown – from multi-award-winning director Cristian Mungiu.

Cristian Mungiu has previously celebrated great successes at Cannes: the Directing Prize for Graduation (Bacalaureat) in 2016, the screenplay prize and best female actress for Beyond the Hills (2011) and a Palme d’Or and the FIPRESCI Prize for 4 months, 3 weeks and 2 days )2007). He has also been a producer for Film i Västs and Filmgate Films co-productions The Father Who Moves Mountains and Lemonade.

Filmgate Films is very proud to have been a part of “Living”, the new film directed by Oliver Hermanus, whose script was adapted together with Nobel prize winner Kazuo Ishiguro. It’s a reimagining of the classic Akira Kurosawa film “IKIRU” from 1952, where here the setting has changed from Tokyo to London.

“Living” premiered at the Sundance Film Festival where it received very high praise. Rolling Stone ranked it as one of the top 10 films from the festival and the acclaim hasn’t stopped there:

“Bill Nighy brings a quiet dignity to the role of Mr Williams, an anchor of buttoned-up solidity in an old-fashioned weepie which captures the lush sentimental swirl of the original while also evoking a distinctive sense of backdrop and period.” - Wendy Ide, Screen Daily

“Hermanus and Ishiguro have taken the decision to set it in 1953 as well, and so ingeniously recasting it as a historical piece: Nighy’s melancholy functionary works in the postwar London county council.” - Peter Bradshaw, The Guardian

“He (Hermanus) and his production team put considerable work into re-creating postwar London…” - Peter Debruge, Variety

Filmgate Films co-produced “Living” alongside Film i Väst, and it has been acquired for the UK by Lionsgate and Sony Pictures Classics which means you can probably see it on the big screen quite soon!

The Romanian action drama, written and directed by Daniel Sandu, has been selected for the main competition - the Golden Goblet Awards - during the 24th Shanghai International Film Festival (SIFF) which takes place between June 11th-20th. This is also where “The Father Who Moves Mountains” will have its world premiere!

This new exciting piece of cinema is about an ex-intelligence officer whose son gets lost in the snowy mountains. When the official search efforts seem to stagnate, the father decides to take the matter into his own hands.

Filmgate Films co-produced this project together with Film i Väst.

Read more:

https://cineuropa.org/en/newsdetail/405605/

https://www.screendaily.com/news/shanghai-unveils-2021-competition-line-up/5160268.article

This collection of darkly comedic stories from visionary debut director Chino Moya has had a small but successful festival run, and now it’s finally being theatrically distributed in the US and UK. In the US the release date is today, May 7th, and in the UK May 17th - so if you have the opportunity, please go ahead and witness the unique experience that is “Undergods”.

Filmgate VFX was nominated for a BIFA in the Best Effects category this year for the VFX work on the film, while Filmgate Films is proud to co-produce alongside Film i Väst.

See the trailer for “Undergods” below:

https://vimeo.com/546405271

This British project from Altitude and ITV is a fresh retelling of the classic spy films starring Michael Caine, which are based on the novels by Len Deighton. This time around the iconic lead role of Harry Palmer will be played by Joe Cole (“Peaky Blinders”, “A Prayer Before Dawn”).

The screenplays are adapted by Oscar nominated and BAFTA award-winning John Hodge, while all six episodes are to be directed by Emmy award-winner James Watkins (“The Woman in Black”, “Black Mirror”). “The Ipcress File” is being produced by Paul Ritchie.

Filmgate is excited to be on board as co-producers with Business Finnish National and West Finland Film Commission.

“The Ipcress File” is being shot during 2021 and will be distributed by ITV.

Read more: https://www.itv.com/presscentre/press-releases/itv-commissions-six-part-spy-thriller-ipcress-file

We are very excited to announce that Filmgate VFX’s supervisors, Martin Malmqvist and Agnes Asplund, have been nominated for a BIFA (British Independent Film Award) for the VFX work on Chino Moya’s debut “Undergods” which was also co-produced by Film i Väst and Filmgate Films. This critically acclaimed feature has been previously recognized for its strong visual elements and we are very proud that those working at Filmgate and especially the supervisors have now also been recognized and nominated in this category for the UK's biggest independent film awards.

See the trailer for the film below!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_2NQjAHZyc0

Corneliu Porumboiu's comedic film noir “The Whistlers” - co-produced by Filmgate Films and Film i Väst - have now received so many awards that it’s becoming hard to keep track!

This time, it got the Grand Prix and the Romanian Filmmakers Union Trophy at the 48th edition of the UCIN Gala. It also won “Best Film in 2019” from the Romanian Critics Association during the same event.

We would just like to say congratulations to Corneliu and the team for the continued success of “The Whistlers”.

Read more: https://www.filmneweurope.com/news/romania-news/item/120642-the-whistlers-wins-romanian-filmmakers-union-trophy

The 14th Gopo Awards was an open-air event this year which took place on June 29th and was hosted by Verde Stop Arena in Bucharest. Corneliu Porumboiu’s comedic film noir “The Whistlers” - co-produced by Filmgate Films together with Film i Väst - swept the show, winning 9 of its 13 nominations, including Best Film, Best Director and Best Script.

Filmgate Films would like to extend a huge congratulations to Corneliu and the whole team behind this acclaimed film.

Read more:

https://www.filmneweurope.com/news/romania-news/item/120221-the-whistler-dominates-14th-gopo-awards

https://www.cineuropa.org/en/newsdetail/389814

Curzon’s cinemas are closed at the moment due to the global pandemic. However, they are giving you the chance to see some of the films from their catalogue at home, with live Q&A:s after the screenings.

One of them is Filmgate Films’ and Film i Västs co-production “Only You”, directed by Harry Wootliff, with Wootliff herself having the online Q&A right after the film. The date for this is Wednesday the 27th at 20:30 (BST). An excellent chance to see the film which Mark Kermode of The Guardian hailed as one of the best from last year.

Read more:

https://www.live.curzonhomecinema.com/

https://filmgate-films.com/only-you

https://www.theguardian.com/film/2019/dec/29/mark-kermode-best-films-of-2019

The star-packed war film “The Last Full Measure” is released on disc today, and is already available for streaming on VOD. This means that you can now see this thrilling and moving true story - with Sebastian Stan, Samuel L. Jackson and William Hurt - from the comfort of your own home. Filmgate Films are co-producers of this film that the public seems to love since it currently has a 96% audience score on Rotten Tomatoes!

Read more: https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_last_full_measure

Thomas Clay’s “Fanny Lye Deliver’d”, co-produced by Filmgate Films, is continuing its festival run. It will have its Nordic premiere at the Gothenburg Film Festival, where it will also be in the International Competition. This is especially exciting news for us, since it will take place at our home base.

Read more: https://program.goteborgfilmfestival.se/program/581138ddf9b5407ebde75417e6a015f8

Our co-production “Only You” has been nominated for a BAFTA (British Academy of Film and Television Arts). Writer/director Harry Wootliff’s film continues its success after winning two BIFA (British Independent Film Awards) last year. This time, the film is nominated in the category “Outstanding Debut by a British Writer, Director or Producer”. The ceremony will take place on February 2nd 2020.

Read more: http://www.bafta.org/film/awards/ee-british-academy-film-awards-nominees-winners-2020#outstanding-debut-by-a-british-writer-director-or-producer

Filmgate Films’ co-production “Fanny Lye Deliver’d” has been selected for the Big Screen Competition at the Rotterdam Film Festival in 2020!

This seductive British period thriller - that had its first screening at the BFI London Film Festival - will have its international premiere at the festival in Rotterdam, which takes place between Jan 22 - Feb 2 next year.

Read more: https://iffr.com/en/2020/films/fanny-lye-deliverd

After a remarkable festival run this year - including being up for the Palme D’Or in Cannes, being shown at the Toronto Film Festival and BFI London Film Festival - “The Whistlers” has now won an award for Best Screenplay at the Seville European Film Festival. The jury’s words justifying their choice of Corneliu Porumboiu’s script were: “For its perverse cleverness.”

Read more: http://festivalcinesevilla.eu/en/news/awards-16th-seville-european-film-festival?fbclid=IwAR0QaQeGyX6Aapsqn20SfR-kWBrb8YDf9Q97vdEt_eaDh0M41MhmVsVIlps

Filmgate Films are proud to announce our involvement in “Rambo: Last Blood”. This hugely anticipated movie is the final entry to the wildly popular action franchise starring Sylvester Stallone.

We were approached to bring some co-production finance with Film i Väst, and Filmgate AB was enlisted to provide some of the VFX for this production. “Rambo: Last Blood” had a global theatrical release on September 20th 2019.
